metadata.Title: CVE-2023-23455 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
atm_tc_enqueue in net/sched/sch_atm.c in the Linux kernel through 6.1.4allows attackers to cause a denial of service because of type confusion(non-negative numbers can sometimes indicate a TC_ACT_SHOT condition ratherthan valid classification results).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-23455` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-208.220
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-208.220
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-208.220
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-208.220
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-208.220
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-144.161~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-144.161~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-208.220').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
